intro: Teucrium ningpoense, commonly known as Ningpo germander, is a perennial herb native to eastern China. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by aromatic leaves and square stems. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink to purple in color, arranged in whorled clusters at the ends of the stems. Teucrium ningpoense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
